short: Default search engine alias used in omnibar
description: Specifies the default search engine to use when performing searches through the omnibar. The value is a single character alias that corresponds to a registered search alias (e.g., 'g' for Google, 'd' for DuckDuckGo). When a user enters a non-URL query in the omnibar without specifying a search engine, the URL template of this default engine is used to construct the search URL.
valueDescription: A single character string representing a search engine alias. Built-in aliases include: 'g' (Google), 'd' (DuckDuckGo), 'b' (Baidu), 'e' (Wikipedia), 'w' (Bing), 's' (Stack Overflow), 'h' (GitHub), 'y' (YouTube), and custom aliases defined by the user via 'addSearchAlias'.

values.description: Any user-defined custom search alias registered via addSearchAlias command
values.source: src/content_scripts/ui/omnibar.js:1426 - Custom aliases added via addSearchAlias

operations.context: Initialized with default value 'g' (Google) in runtime configuration object
Used to look up the default search engine alias in searchEngine.aliases to construct the search URL when a non-URL query is entered in omnibar
Referenced to determine which search engine to use by default for omnibar searches

notes: This setting determines the fallback search engine when a user types a search query in the omnibar without prefixing it with a search engine alias. The value must correspond to a valid search engine alias; using an undefined alias will result in a JavaScript error. Custom search engines can be added through the 'addSearchAlias' function, which dynamically registers new aliases at runtime. The setting is user-configurable and persists across browser sessions.
